ygData.subject: RE: Market in EQ
ygData.msgSnippet: Sounds like a good IDEA. And, I wouldn t want them to spend any time on it. I don t like the idea, personally. Last thing I wanna go spend my hard earned plat
ygData.messageBody:
Sounds like a good IDEA. And, I wouldn't want them to spend any time on it.
I don't like the idea, personally. Last thing I wanna go spend my hard
earned plat on is replacing my tunic. And, i's the last thing I'd like to
see Verant spending time coding on. It is an idea tho...

-Zantaer/Leod, Fennin Ro, SOK

-----Original Message-----
From: velom@... [mailto:velom@...]
Sent: Tuesday, July 13, 1999 3:18 PM
To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
Subject: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Market in EQ


From: velom@...

I was reading an email from someone that compared the EQ market to the US
market. They stated that one reason they are different is because in RL
things wear out and in EQ they are eternal. This is so true. Has anyone
thought of or actually talked to Verant about having armor wear out? This
would cause buyers to go to smiths for repairs or replacements. I don't
know if this seems like a good idea or not. I think it does. Let me know
what you all think of this idea.
